Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
Teamwork
<product, software, tool> A {SASD} tool from {Sterling Software}, formerly {CADRE Technologies}, which supports the {Shlaer/Mellor} {Object-Oriented} method and the {Yourdon-DeMarco}, {Hatley-Pirbhai}, {Constantine} and {Buhr} notations.
Teamwork was abandoned when {Computer Associates} acquired Sterling Software in March 2000.
(2002-05-29)

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Teamwork \Team"work`\, n. 1. Work done by a team, as distinguished from that done by personal labor. [1913 Webster]
2. Work done by a number of associates, usually each doing a clearly defined portion, but all subordinating personal prominence to the efficiency of the whole; as, the teamwork of a football eleven or a gun crew. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
Is the teamwork system employed, or does one workman make the whole cigar? --U. S. Consular Repts. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
teamwork n : cooperative work done by a team
